top_categories.workout_context: Hardwood Hustle rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Hardwood Hustle’s gravel roads, hardwood forest demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Hardwood Hustle when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hardwood Hustle. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing Hardwood Hustle isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The varied gradients at Hardwood Hustle reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Hardwood Hustle’s hardwood forest gravel roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Hardwood Hustle — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Hardwood Hustle’s hardwood forest gravel roads drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Hardwood Hustle — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Hardwood Hustle’s 3,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Hardwood Hustle — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on hardwood forest gravel roads.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Hardwood Hustle’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hardwood Hustle requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on hardwood forest gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, hardwood forest, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of hardwood forest gravel roads in Nelma, Wisconsin.
